studies.py¶

job_monitoring_app.backend.app.services.studies.create_study(db: Session, study: StudyCreate, provider: User) → Study¶

Create a new study for a provider, add it to the database, and return the study.

Args:

db (Session): Database session study (schemas.StudyCreate): Study information provider (models.User): Provider information

Returns:

models.Study: The newly created Study

job_monitoring_app.backend.app.services.studies.get_studies_for_hospital(db: Session, user_id: int) → list[Study]¶

Get all studies associated with the hospital with the given user_id

Args:

db (Session): Database session user_id (int): The user id

Returns:

list[models.Study]: List of studies

job_monitoring_app.backend.app.services.studies.get_studies_for_provider(db: Session, user_id: int) → list[Study]¶

Get all studies associated with the provider with the given user_id

Args:

db (Session): Database session user_id (int): The user id

Returns:

list[models.Study]: List of studies

job_monitoring_app.backend.app.services.studies.get_study_by_id(db: Session, study_id: int) → Study¶

Get a study by its id

Args:

db (Session): Database session study_id (int): The study id

Returns:

models.Study: The study with the given id

job_monitoring_app.backend.app.services.studies.get_study_by_provider_study_id(db: Session, provider_study_id: str, provider_id: int) → Study¶

Get a study by its provider_study_id and provider_id

Args:

db (Session): Database session provider_study_id (str): The provider’s study id provider_id (int): The provider’s user id

Returns:

models.Study: The study
